item.title: Suge Knight’s Son Talks About Snoop Dogg’s New Ownership Of Death Row Records
item.dc:creator: favology
item.description:
The son of Death Row Records founder Suge Knight has spoken about Snoop Dogg’s recent acquisition of the famed record label. Speaking to TMZ, Suge Jacob Knight said that “it’s a victory for the West Coast” and that he is happy just like everyone else. “I’m just happy it’s coming back to the West Coast,” he […]

The post Suge Knight’s Son Talks About Snoop Dogg’s New Ownership Of Death Row Records appeared first on Favology.
item.content:encoded:
The son of Death Row Records founder Suge Knight has spoken about Snoop Dogg’s recent acquisition of the famed record label.

Speaking to TMZ, Suge Jacob Knight said that “it’s a victory for the West Coast” and that he is happy just like everyone else. “I’m just happy it’s coming back to the West Coast,” he said. “And now, hopefully we can start winning because we lost Nipsey [Hussle], we lost Kobe [Bryant] — I mean, we lost a lot of things even after my dad went to jail, we started losing.”

He revealed that his father is not “punching the air” with Snoop’s new ownership of his record label, clarifying that they understand the business, “Eazy-E and my pops was cool. Snoop and my pops is cool. And other people are cool in the industry, people just don’t understand that.”

Snoop Dogg, who acquired Death Row Records from MNRK Music Group, recently said, “I am thrilled and appreciative of the opportunity to acquire the iconic and culturally significant Death Row Records brand, which has immense untapped future value. It feels good to have ownership of the label I was part of at the beginning of my career and as one of the founding members. This is an extremely meaningful moment for me.”

The post Suge Knight’s Son Talks About Snoop Dogg’s New Ownership Of Death Row Records appeared first on Favology.

item.title: Kanye Refusing to Perform at Coachella Unless Billie Eilish Apologizes to Travis Scott
item.dc:creator: favology
item.description:
Following a news story about Billie Eilish stopping a show to assist a fan, Kanye West now wants the 20-year-old singer to apologize to Travis Scott. During a stop for Eilish’s Happier Than Ever World Tour, an instance occurred at Atlanta’s State Farm Arena. The performance was momentarily halted for a fan in need of […]

The post Kanye Refusing to Perform at Coachella Unless Billie Eilish Apologizes to Travis Scott appeared first on Favology.
item.content:encoded:
Following a news story about Billie Eilish stopping a show to assist a fan, Kanye West now wants the 20-year-old singer to apologize to Travis Scott. During a stop for Eilish’s Happier Than Ever World Tour, an instance occurred at Atlanta’s State Farm Arena. The performance was momentarily halted for a fan in need of an inhaler, and the artist stated, “I wait for the people to be okay before I keep going.”

Soon after, many media sources began reporting on the comment’s apparent target towards Travis Scott, referencing the Astroworld Festival accident.

Kanye West took to Instagram to post a screenshot of a headline, along with a caption. “COME ON BILLIE WE LOVE YOU PLEASE APOLOGIZE TO TRAV AND TO THE FAMILIES OF THE PEOPLE WHO LOST THEIR LIVES NO ONE INTENDED THIS TO HAPPEN TRAV DIDN’T HAVE ANY IDEA OF WHAT WAS HAPPENING WHEN HE WAS ON STAGE AND WAS VERY HURT BY WHAT HAPPENED.”

Ye went on to reveal that Travis Scott will be with him at Coachella, where the two are headlining, and requested an apology before his performance. “YES TRAV WILL BE WITH ME AT COACHELLA BUT NOW I NEED BILLIE TO APOLOGIZE BEFORE I PERFORM.”

After the comments were made, it was revealed that Billie Eilish did not write them toward Travis. She has since added to Ye’s Instagram post, stating that she was not directed her words toward him. “Literally never said a thing about Travis. Was just helping a fan.”

The post Kanye Refusing to Perform at Coachella Unless Billie Eilish Apologizes to Travis Scott appeared first on Favology.

item.title: Kanye West’s New “Yemobile” Resembles Batman’s Batmobile
item.dc:creator: Ahsanul Karim
item.description:
Kanye West, the man who is now better known as just Ye has revealed his latest whip. Some have drawn comparisons between this vehicle to Batman’s Batmobile but one thing is certain – for Kanye, it’s simply “the Yemobile.” The name of the car may be a mouthful, but it’s no stranger to making moves. […]

The post Kanye West’s New “Yemobile” Resembles Batman’s Batmobile appeared first on Favology.
item.content:encoded:
Kanye West, the man who is now better known as just Ye has revealed his latest whip. Some have drawn comparisons between this vehicle to Batman’s Batmobile but one thing is certain – for Kanye, it’s simply “the Yemobile.”

The name of the car may be a mouthful, but it’s no stranger to making moves. Just last year the DONDA rapper was auctioning off six cars from his Wyoming collection which totaled over $434 800 USD! After reports surfaced saying that he sold one of these custom Ripsaw EV2 tanks for nearly half a million dollars in Diesel Brothers country – it seems like this high-profile artist has added yet another supercar onto his fleet: A modified BAC Mono named “Yemobile.”

The company specializes in making road-legal sports vehicles that only have 12 dealership agreements across four continents. Their first generation ended at the end of 2020, but they were able to come out with a new model soon after just like how we saw last year when there was also an update for their second version which went on sale around 2021 timeframes.

Expecting to be the second-generation BAC Mono, this car features a lightweight body and an aerodynamic interior. With an engine that delivers 332 horsepower for Mountune powered by VE Technology Group Inc., it can reach speeds up to 60 mph in just 2.7 seconds! The starting price is approximately USD 220k.

Let’s take a look at the “Yemobile” below.

The post Kanye West’s New “Yemobile” Resembles Batman’s Batmobile appeared first on Favology.

item.title: Pusha T & Kanye West Team Up For ‘Diet Coke’
item.dc:creator: Ahsanul Karim
item.description:
Pusha T is slated to drop his official follow-up to Daytona, which was released in 2018. Fans have been waiting for new music for a long time, but Push has refused to give in to the pressure. Instead, he kept supporters on the edge of their seats until he was ready to deliver some serious […]

The post Pusha T & Kanye West Team Up For ‘Diet Coke’ appeared first on Favology.
item.content:encoded:
Pusha T is slated to drop his official follow-up to Daytona, which was released in 2018. Fans have been waiting for new music for a long time, but Push has refused to give in to the pressure. Instead, he kept supporters on the edge of their seats until he was ready to deliver some serious heat.

The first track “Diet Coke” was dropped on Tuesday (February 8). King Push has released the video for the track just hours after it was released. The black-and-white visual, directed by Omar Jones and Onda, features Kanye West — who co-produced the song with 88-Keys — and Pusha T nodding along to the beat while the Clipse MC fires off his iconic cocaine bars.

Push’s manager Steven Victor recently told Complex that Push’s album “is coming sooner than you think,” adding that they were coming “back-to-back.” It seems like we could be getting this Push album after Kanye drops Donda 2 which is scheduled to be released on Feb. 22nd.

[WATCH] Pusha T’s “Diet Coke” music video co-starring Kanye West.

The post Pusha T & Kanye West Team Up For ‘Diet Coke’ appeared first on Favology.

item.title: Kanye West’s ‘Late Orchestration’ Album Finally Hits Streaming
item.dc:creator: Ahsanul Karim
item.description:
Nearly 16 years after its initial release, Kanye West’s 2006 live album Late Orchestration is now available on streaming platforms. The album, recorded in front of a 300-person audience at Abbey Road Studios in London, England in September 2005, was first released on CD and DVD before making its way onto streaming services late Tuesday […]

The post Kanye West’s ‘Late Orchestration’ Album Finally Hits Streaming appeared first on Favology.
item.content:encoded:
Nearly 16 years after its initial release, Kanye West’s 2006 live album Late Orchestration is now available on streaming platforms.

The album, recorded in front of a 300-person audience at Abbey Road Studios in London, England in September 2005, was first released on CD and DVD before making its way onto streaming services late Tuesday night. The medley of tracks from Kanye’s first two albums, 2004’s The College Dropout and 2005’s Late Registration, is included on the 13-track project.

Backed by a 17-piece all-female string orchestra, Ye performed four songs from his debut (“Through the Wire,” “Jesus Walks,” “All Falls Down,” and “The New Workout Plan”), as well as nine. songs from his sophomore LP, including the No. 1 hit “Gold Digger” and the fan-favorite “Gone” featuring Cam’ron and Consequence.

The live album has only been available in limited international markets (perhaps due to licensing issues) until now but on late Tuesday night, fans noticed that it had also popped up in the U.S. on all major DSPs including Apple Music, Spotify, and TIDAL.

You can listen to Ye’s Late Orchestration on Spotify now. Press play and enjoy below.

The post Kanye West’s ‘Late Orchestration’ Album Finally Hits Streaming appeared first on Favology.

item.title: Bad Bunny Shows Up In The JACQUEMUS’ “LE SPLASH” Campaign
item.dc:creator: Ahsanul Karim
item.description:
Bad Bunny is headlining more than his current tour, and JACQUEMUS has released a new ad campaign for its Le Splash collection. The Puerto Rican musician was photographed in Miami when he collaborated with the fashion label to link up their collaboration.

The post Bad Bunny Shows Up In The JACQUEMUS’ “LE SPLASH” Campaign appeared first on Favology.
item.content:encoded:
Bad Bunny is headlining more than his current tour, and JACQUEMUS has released a new ad campaign for its Le Splash collection. The Puerto Rican musician was photographed in Miami when he collaborated with the fashion label to link up their collaboration.

Roller skating, Bad Bunny stars in JACQUEMUS’ Le Splash campaign.

The new JACQUEMUS campaign features the photography of Tom Kneller and Bad Bunny. His 27-year old star shines through in these vibrant photos, which are styled by Zoey Radford Scott for their advertisement purposes only!

Bad Bunny wears a lime green suit for JACQUEMUS’ Le Splash campaign.

The gender-neutral, welcoming spirit of JACQUEMUS is mirrored by Bad Bunny’s charismatic energy. His outfits are always outlandishly fashionable and full sensory experiences for the senses. In everything from a pink dress to a lime green suit, he brings his fiery attitude with him as if it were part of himself.

Rocking a pink halter top dress, Bad Bunny fronts JACQUEMUS’ Le Splash campaign.

Riding a bike and wearing an embellished gray suit, Bad Bunny stars in JACQUEMUS’ Le Splash campaign.

Enjoying a day in Miami, Bad Bunny roller skating and appears in JACQUEMUS’ Le Splash campaign.

Sporting a blazer and underwear, Bad Bunny is the life of the party as the star of JACQUEMUS’ Le Splash campaign.

Breaking with gender norms, Bad Bunny wears a pink dress with heels for JACQUEMUS’ Le Splash campaign.

Bad Bunny wears a yellow ribbed knit sweater for JACQUEMUS’ Le Splash campaign.

Making a statement in a green suit, Bad Bunny fronts JACQUEMUS’ Le Splash campaign.

Sport matching green eyewear and shorts, Bad Bunny relaxes poolside for JACQUEMUS Le Splash campaign.

Bad Bunny goes sans pants as he sports a pink vest for JACQUEMUS’ Le Splash campaign.

Take a look at the campaign, and stay tuned to Jacquemus’ Instagram account for more information about the “LE SPLASH” collection, which is soon to come.

The post Bad Bunny Shows Up In The JACQUEMUS’ “LE SPLASH” Campaign appeared first on Favology.

item.title: Snoop Dogg Acquires Death Row Records
item.dc:creator: favology
item.description:
Snoop Dogg has acquired the legendary record label Death Row. Snoop has cemented his status as an entertainment legend and hip-hop luminary by broadening his empire while sealing the acquisition of the label that launched him. MNRK Music Group formerly owned Death Row Records. In a statement, Snoop spoke of the deal saying, “I am thrilled […]

The post Snoop Dogg Acquires Death Row Records appeared first on Favology.
item.content:encoded:
Snoop Dogg has acquired the legendary record label Death Row. Snoop has cemented his status as an entertainment legend and hip-hop luminary by broadening his empire while sealing the acquisition of the label that launched him. MNRK Music Group formerly owned Death Row Records. In a statement, Snoop spoke of the deal saying,

“I am thrilled and appreciative of the opportunity to acquire the iconic and culturally significant Death Row Records brand, which has immense untapped future value. It feels good to have ownership of the label I was part of at the beginning of my career and as one of the founding members. This is an extremely meaningful moment for me. I would like to personally thank the teams at Blackstone, MNRK and especially David Kestnbaum, who worked collaboratively with me over several months to make this exciting homecoming a reality. I’m looking forward to building the next chapter of Death Row Records.”

Suge Knight, Dr. Dre, and other prominent figures in the music industry launched Death Row Records in the early 1990s. Dr. Dre’s The Chronic and Snoop Dogg’s Doggystyle are just a few of the history-making hip-hop albums recorded at this facility, which also hosted such classics as Tupac Shakur’s All Eyez on Me, Dr. Dre’s The Chronic, and Snoop Dogg’s own Doggystyle mixtape. However, in 2006, Death Row filed for bankruptcy and went through a succession of owners before being acquired by toy company Hasbro.

This is a significant accomplishment for Snoop Dogg, who lamented in December of last year that he didn’t get the chance to buy Death Row Records when he had the opportunity. It appears that Snoop has achieved his ambition and attracted the attention of those in the business, with Kanye West praising it as the best example of “Black Future Month.”

The post Snoop Dogg Acquires Death Row Records appeared first on Favology.

item.title: Olivia Rodrigo Named 2022 Billboard’s ‘Woman of the Year’
item.dc:creator: Ahsanul Karim
item.description:
Olivia Rodrigo has been chosen Woman of the Year by Billboard, just a few months after being selected TIME Magazine’s Entertainer of the Year. This further establishes the 18-year-old as a force to be reckoned with. The young pop star has enjoyed a meteoric rise since releasing her debut album, SOUR, in May, and she’s […]

The post Olivia Rodrigo Named 2022 Billboard’s ‘Woman of the Year’ appeared first on Favology.
item.content:encoded:
Olivia Rodrigo has been chosen Woman of the Year by Billboard, just a few months after being selected TIME Magazine’s Entertainer of the Year. This further establishes the 18-year-old as a force to be reckoned with.

The young pop star has enjoyed a meteoric rise since releasing her debut album, SOUR, in May, and she’s now set to be honored at the Billboard Women in Music Awards on March 2.

The company will also recognize the efforts of several other female musical artists during the upcoming ceremony. Cardi B, Billie Eilish, and Ariana Grande are among the former awardees.

Hannah Karp, the Editorial Director of Billboard, said in a statement that Rodrigo’s journey to popularity was particularly impressive.

“Olivia’s trajectory to superstardom is the stuff of pop music legend,” said Hannah Karp. “Her talents as a storyteller and songwriter have made Olivia one of the most authentic and exciting new artists to explode onto the scene in years.”

Gabby Barrett, Phoebe Bridgers, Doja Cat, Karol G, Bonnie Raitt, Saweetie, and Summer Walker were among the other awardees at the Billboard Women in Music Awards.

Rodrigo will be honored at the March Billboard WIM event in Los Angeles. Tickets are on sale now. Fans will be able to purchase tickets for the first time this year.

Buy Tickets Now

The post Olivia Rodrigo Named 2022 Billboard’s ‘Woman of the Year’ appeared first on Favology.
